title: Mission Driven NFTs
description: ブランドを育てることは、NFTコレクションを立ち上げるのと同じくらい簡単なことです。(88％の消費者が「目的を持った企業から買いたい」と答えています。

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal has the meta-level: socialgiving.io (this seems to be the ultimate goal)

Then it has the proof-of-concept level: wheelzupnft.com (this is the first project implemented with the socialgiving idea)

Might have been better to break this down to two different funds: first launch the wheelzup and then the socialgiving.

Still, it's a very interesting approach to using NFTs and although it still needs work and refinement, it's amazing how much thought and effort has gone into this already.

FYI Voters:
Cheryl's video is worth watching if you want a sneak peek into the WheelzUp NFTs and the ideas behind this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8ZUf1SYu1uY&list=PLRtyE1Zje7Aknqd7QePRaXVIcsuaLWY8j&index=2

Once the socialgiving.io is properly up and running and the NFT-approach is battle-tested I could see our company using this not only for do-gooding purposes but also for guerrilla marketing and recruitment.
f6_assessments.q1:
Seeing the comments, it's obvious that this proposal submission has already been very beneficial for the proposer. The idea has morphed into something else and it might continue morphing after implementation. That is not necessarily a bad thing; pivoting is more important than sticking to ideas that don't work. Having said that, the proposer's biggest strength seems to be listening and incorporating feedback. That gives me confidence that something might come out of this. 

Additional team members could help provide another angle and make the wheelzup "the first killer app" for socialgiving (referring to the conversation in the comment section).
f6_assessments.q2:
Considering the expected impact and scope of the project, the budget is clearly only for the proof of concept phase. I just don't understand why you don't ask the entire sum? Why only $10,000 USD? No need to be humble here. Ask what is needed to pull this through.

Should you feel the need to take a step back and reflect the applicability of the approach once more, I could give one advice: make it bloody simple! :)

Check the movie "Pay It Forward" if you need inspiration for a simple idea. There the boy does something nice to three people and doesn't expect anything from them. He only asks them to do something nice for three others. You could actually take that approach also. Make three tribes and choose three people to get get the ball rolling. Create the original NFTs for them and code it so that it's only possible to make three copies of that NFT. Then the "next level" needs to scan a QR code or something and get the next three each. And so it goes. You had mentioned in your PDF that there are 13 different traits of the NFT. This way you could make them all a bit unique. You could make it a competition between the three tribes: who reaches the level 100 first, for instance. This would also help you validate that something nice was done to another person.

f6_assessments.q0: Addressing the impact of using a service or product clearly seen and understood. This is a laudable idea to ensure effective customer care and satisfaction.
f6_assessments.q1: All details of ensuring good implementation is clearly stated and understood. Minimal ambiguity but on the whole the purpose of a customer need being satisfied is understood, which will ensure continuous patronage of goods and services of a particular industry and thereby growth of the business through blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: Some details of budget provided but the proposer needs to provide more details and not just stating bulk amounts.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating NFTs for businesses addresses the challenge brief of creating business models with NFT's at the core. Businesses minting NFTs will increase the use and number of NFTs on Cardano, thus increasing utility and providing value to the ecosystem. The problem statement and solution read disconnected at the moment, I would like the team to refine the problem statement (Problem= Busineses lack of knowledge to use Cardano, Solution = our platform to educate and provide framework for business).
f6_assessments.q1: The team provided a links to a Linked. I would like the team to expand on the task allocation that each member will be responsible for, this way we can better judge whether there is a work overload in one area. I would like the team to expand on the plan to go to market, acquire customers and educate brands. Lastly, the project will require additional funding in future for phase 2, I would like the team to clarify how future funding will be raised. LAstly, the amount requested for funding does not match the cost of the items listed under spending.
f6_assessments.q2: I would like to see the budget broken down into monthly spending and I would like the team to connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the spending, what are the specific tasks and deliverables that the labor must provide and when must they deliver the tasks – this breakdown will give a clearer indication about the implementation workload feasibility and match the deliverables to the labor spending I thus providing a mechanism tracking performance and spending over time. As the project stand at the moment, I feel the project will be difficult to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: Brilliant concept and impressive documentation even though it's not all contained within the main body of the proposal. Need to move all your links so voters can find them. The proposal certainly addresses the challenge and bodes well for adding value to the Cardano ecosystem. There is much work to be done I sense but you've made a terrific start.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal indicates the proposer is a an experienced networker with a strong business background. The documents are high quality and the concept is a winner (I want an NFT and I really want to validate it by completing the attached social mission). Design of the NFT's will be important as will design of the missions themselves. The plan attached may need some revision but I sense this team are very open to new iterations to achieve quality so am confident that will occur. The budget needs some work, I note you have revised the amount requested. The current budget is reasonable and if this takes off like I feel it may I could see this project being self sufficient very quickly.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is quite unique in that it has captured the mood of many in the Cardano community (social empowerment) and coupled this with a business model that will be rewarding on many potential levels. The goodwill that may be generated is quite exciting. I can see individual NFT's becoming famous simply because they attach to a positive social action. They may even become an artifact of sorts...with that in mind the sky is the limit.  Your metrics/KPI's need a little tweaking as does a breakdown of the budget. I really feel you have produced a brilliant proposal.

solution: 企業がミッションに基づいたNFTを作ることで、ブロックチェーン技術と現実世界のインパクトを統合するための枠組みを作る。
experience: シリコンバレーで7年間、スタートアップ企業のIPOを支援。5つの中小企業を設立。アマゾン・プライム・ビデオで、成長中の100万人以上のコミュニティを立ち上げました。
